docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Federal Communications Commission is granting an emergency temporary waiver to Jewish community centers and telecommunications carriers that serve them to help track down callers who have made threats, the agency said on Friday.

headline.print_headline: FCC Approves Waivers to Track Jewish Center Threats
headline.main: FCC Approves Waivers to Track Jewish Center Threats

docs.snippet: The U.S. Federal Communications Commission is granting an emergency temporary waiver to Jewish community centers and telecommunications carriers that serve them to help track down callers who have made threats, the agency said on Friday....

docs.lead_paragraph: The state of Michigan appears increasingly unlikely to follow through on threats to close up to 38 chronically low-performing schools in Detroit and seven other cities this summer.

headline.print_headline: Michigan Offers to Prevent or Delay School Closures
headline.main: Michigan Offers to Prevent or Delay School Closures

docs.snippet: The state of Michigan appears increasingly unlikely to follow through on threats to close up to 38 chronically low-performing schools in Detroit and seven other cities this summer....

docs.lead_paragraph: The male North Carolina police officer captured on video slamming a female high school student to the floor has resigned.

docs.lead_paragraph: Deutsche Boerse Chief Executive Carsten Kengeter said it is continuing preparations for a merger with the London Stock Exchange, despite the LSE's refusal to sell its Italian MTS trading platform.

headline.print_headline: Deutsche Boerse CEO Says Work on LSE Merger Still Ongoing
headline.main: Deutsche Boerse CEO Says Work on LSE Merger Still Ongoing

docs.lead_paragraph: Paula Fox, a prize-winning author who created high art out of imagined chaos in such novels as "Poor George" and "Desperate Characters" and out of the real-life upheavals in her memoir "Borrowed Finery," has died at age 93.

headline.print_headline: Paula Fox, Prize Winning Author, Dead at 93
headline.main: Paula Fox, Prize Winning Author, Dead at 93

docs.snippet: Paula Fox, a prize-winning author who created high art out of imagined chaos in such novels as "Poor George" and "Desperate Characters" and out of the real-life upheavals in her memoir "Borrowed Finery," has died at age 93....

docs.lead_paragraph: Massachusetts will plug any holes in the budget of the state chapter of Planned Parenthood if the U.S. Congress moves to block the use of Medicaid funds for treatment at the women's health care organization, Governor Charlie Baker said on Friday.

headline.print_headline: Massachusetts to Plug Gap if Congress Blocks Planned Parenthood Funds
headline.main: Massachusetts to Plug Gap if Congress Blocks Planned Parenthood Funds

docs.snippet: Massachusetts will plug any holes in the budget of the state chapter of Planned Parenthood if the U.S. Congress moves to block the use of Medicaid funds for treatment at the women's health care organization, Governor Charlie Baker said on Friday....

docs.lead_paragraph: Uber has been wielding a secret weapon to thwart authorities who have been trying to curtail or shut down its ride-hailing service in cities around the world.
